definition: A US-based company that designs and builds robots in the areas of mapping and navigation, human-robot interaction, and physical solutions. The company was founded in 1990 by Massachusetts Institute of Technology roboticists. The company inspired the first Micro Rovers used by NASA, deployed the first ground robots used by U.S. Forces in conflict, brought the first self-navigating FDA-approved remote presence robots to hospitals and introduced the first practical home robot with Roomba.
Collaboration between the Laboratoire d'Etudes en Geophysique et Oceanographie Spatiales (France), the Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (France) and NKE Instrumentation (France).
A Swiss company which is part of Hexagon AB. GeoMax AG specialises in geospatial solutions including survery instrumentation and software.

A global company, headquartered in Porchester (UK) that design and manufacture unmanned and autonomous marine systems for military, security, offshore energy and scientific applications. It has facilities in the UK, USA and Brazil.
A Canadian company founded in 2004. Xeos Technologies specialises in the design and manufacture of telemetry and data collection products.
A US-based company established in 2023, headquartered in Chicago, Illinois. Formerly a subsidary of General Electric, GE Healthcare specialises in manufacturing and distributing medical technology.
A manufacturing company based in the Netherlands that manufactures the Waverider wave measurement sensor unit.

A provider of instrument systems for globally corrected positioning, with applications in hydrographic activities, deepwater seafloor mapping, subsea surveys, and offshore oilfield exloration. C and C Technologies was acquired by Oceaneering International Inc. on April 2nd, 2015.

A Canadian company that specialises in systems that measure marine turbulence. It designs and manufactures high accuracy instrumentation for oceanographic research that are deployable in coastal and deep sea applications.  It was founded in 2005, by co-founders Rolf Lueck and Fabian Wolk.

A US-based developer and manufacturer of innovative optical solutions for clients and enterprises across the globe. Products range from high magnification motorized zoom imaging systems to fisheye projection lenses used in a wide variety of industries. Founded in 1946 as Egleet Optical and rebranded to Navitar in 1954.
A UK-based company that is part of the Seiche Group. It manufactures the AutoNaut range of wave propelled unmanned surface vessels (USV). It was formed in 2016 from MOST (Autonomous Vessels) Ltd.
A company founded in 1975 in Aylesbury, UK. Liter Meter specialises in the design, manufacture and supply of flow meters.

prefLabel: Pyro Science and Graz University of Technology
definition: Collaboration between Pyro Science, Germany and the Graz University of Technology, Austria.

A UK-based company that designs, manufactures and sells small low cost Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (AUVs) for environmental monitoring in research, defense, oil and gas industries. The company was spun out of Planet Ocean Limited, a marine science technology specialist, following extensive collaboration with the Marine Autonomous Robotics Systems (MARS) group at the National Oceanography Centre (NOC), UK. It was incorporated on the 27 April 2016. It is headquartered in Camberley, UK.

A manufacturer of Unmanned Underwater Vehicles (UUVs). It was established in 2001 by the inventors of the REMUS UUV. It became a subsidiary of Kongsberg Maritime in 2008. It has been part of the Huntington Ingalls Industries since 2020.
A manufacturer of microsensors and instrumentation for microscale measurement based in Denmark.

A leading developer and supplier of a wide range of infrared imaging products, including cooled and uncooled infrared detectors, camera cores, and finished cameras. Founded as FLIR Systems in 1978 and acquired by Teledyne Technologies in 2021, FLIR has rebranded as Teledyne FLIR. Teledyne FLIR operates in many locations around the globe and employs a total of over 3000 dedicated employees.

An engineering company founded in 1906 by Mark Honeywell under the name Honeywell Speciality Company. It operates in four areas of business: aerospace, building technologies, performance materials and technologies (PMT), and safety and productivity solutions (SPS).
A US-based subsidiary of The Boeing Company, that designs and manufacturers the Wave Glider range of autonomous, unmanned surface vehicles (USVs).

A US-based company founded in 1968, headquartered in Salem, New Hampshire. Klein specialises in the design and manufacturing of high resolution survey solutions for hydrographic and defense applications.
A UK-based company founded in 1937, headquartered in London, specialising in appliances,electrical, and electronics manufacturing. RS Pro is the own brand of RS group plc.

A German company that designs and manufacturs technologies for use in the aquatic environment: In lakes, rivers, oceans; for oceanography, limnology, hydrology, coastal protection, civil engineering, etc., including flow meters, multi-parameter probes, and directional sea-state probes. The company was founded in 2001.

A global company that specialises in the manufacture and distribution of analytical instruments and reagents for quality testing of water and other liquid solutions in both laboratory and field settings. The company was founded in Iowa, USA in 1947, and is now headquartered in Colorado, USA.

A US manufacturer of aerospace and defense technology, also known as the Bell Aircraft Corporation. Bell Aerospace was founded in 1935 and purchased in 1960 by Textron, and currently exists as Bell Textron.
A US-based company founded in 1972, headquartered in Redmond, Washington, specialising in the manufacturing of high precision pressure instrumentation.

A UK-based company that specialised in motion sensor and subsea pipe/cable tracking. In 2000, TSS was merged with S G Brown Ltd. by their parent company, Vosper Thornycroft, to form VT TSS International. This company was later purchased by the Teledyne group in 2008 to form Teledyne TSS.

prefLabel: Natural Resources Canada, Geological Survey of Canada
definition: The Geological Survey of Canada, including the Pacific Geoscience Centre, forms part of the Earth Sciences sector of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). Founded in 1842, it is Canada's national organization for geoscientific information and research.

Avantes is a manufacturing company based in the Netherlands that specialises in instruments for spectroscopy and fibre optic applications. They have direct offices in the USA and China, and distributors in 35 countries. Founded in 1994.

A French-based, global company that provides navigation, positioning, imaging and photonics for sea, land, air and space applications. It is recognised for its work on the development of Fibre-Optic Gyroscopes (FOG). It was founded in 1998 and has operations in over 30 countries.
A Belgian designer and manufacturer of GPS/GNSS receivers for industrial applications, with offices worldwide. Founded in 2000.

A German company based in Kiel that specialised in the development and production of hydroacoustic systems, including sonar systems, echosounders and underwater communication systems with military and commercial applications. L-3 ELAC Nautik was the result of the acquisition of AlliedSignal ELAC Nautik GmbH by L-3 Communications in 1998. L-3 Communications ELAC Nautik GmbH persisted until 2015 when it was sold to Wärtsillä to become Wärtsillä ELAC Nautik GmbH, which was then sold again in 2020 to Cohort plc and renamed ELAC SONAR.

A US-based company specialising in the manufacture and distribution of Orion, Pulsar, Magellan, and Capricorn weather station systems. Founded in 1998, initially as a subsidiary of Hinds Instruments, Inc.

A Texas, US based company focused on the development and application of advanced sound and vibration transducer technology. These include seismic sensors for energy exploration and scientific monitoring, microphones for consumer communication and hearing device applications, and sensors for measuring wind in extreme flow conditions.
Dynamic Gravity Systems manufactures and services advanced technology gravity meters for airborne, marine, and land geophysical survey applications. Founded in April 2013.
A South Burlington, Vermont-based company that has been manufacturing specialty flow meters since 1998.
A designer and manufacturer of advanced underwater measurement and observation systems specialising in plankton imaging systems and cabled seafloor observatories. Founded in 2015.

A US-based company providing service, calibration, and rental of industrial instruments. The company offers a wide variety of products such as tools, safety products, electronic productions tools, laboratory instruments and supplies, as well as computer hardware, software and supplies. Founded in 1989.

A Swedish designer and manufacturer of commercial radio and software products for civil and military customers within the maritime industry, part of the Saab AB group founded in 1937. Saab AB TransponderTech is located in Hackefors, Linkoping.
A UK-based company founded in 1972, that specialising in the design and manufacture of pressure instrumentation.

A manufacturer of underwater lights, cameras, pressure-compensated batteries, lasers, and pressure relief valves for the most demanding deep water applications, including: ROVs, AUVs, divers, and manned submersibles, it represents the subsea market as part of SeeScan, Inc. It also offers pressure testing services with chambers rated up to 30 ksi.
A US and New Zealand based company that designs, manufactures and sells custom marine tags and provides telemetry and project solutions to the scientific community. Founded in 1984.

The University Marine Biological Station Millport (UMBSM) was a higher education institution located on the island of Great Cumbrae in the Firth of Clyde, Scotland, and run by the University of London. It closed in 2013 and is now the Millport Field Centre, run by the Field Studies Council.

prefLabel: Netherlands Organization for Applied Scientific Research
definition: A Netherlands based independent research organisation founded in 1932. It specialises in providing solutions to major challenges facing societies. It was initially divided into fifteen institutions, including TNO-NITG, until a re-organisation in 2005.

Designers, manufacturers and suppliers of limnological, hydrobiological and oceanographic sampling and monitoring apparatus. They also supply sampling equipment for waste and industrial bi-products, discharges as well as active wastes.

A US based manufacturer and designer of products, including environmental sensors, GPS receivers, and satellite telemetry systems; used to track currents and ice motion, collect environmental data, and mark remotely deployed assets. Founded in 2010.

Picarro is a provider of solutions to measure greenhouse gas concentrations, trace gases and stable isotopes across many scientific applications, along with the energy and utilities markets. Founded in 1998.
A producer of time and frequency instruments. The company is located in California and was founded in 1998.
A Danish company which is part of the Teledyne Marine Acoustic Imaging Group. Teledyne Odom Hydrographic specialises in subsea imaging and multibeam echosounder solutions.
A US-based company establised in Miami, Florida in 1966 that designs and manufactures water sampling products and instruments for the oceanographic community.

prefLabel: Consortium for Advanced Research on Transport of Hydrocarbon in the Environment
definition: A collaboration of over forty scientific researchers, postdocs, students and administrative staff from fourteen universities and research institutions. Funded by the Gulf of Mexico Research Initiative (GoMRI), CARTHE's scientific work is based on one of GoMRI's intellectual themes and focuses on the physical distribution, dispersion and dilution of petroleum, its constituents and associated contaminants under the action of physical oceanographic processes, air-sea interactions and tropical storms.

A company that manufactures and supplies GPS-aided inertial measurements units (IMU), attitude and heading reference systems (AHRS), vertical gyroscopes and inclinometer/tilt sensors. The company was derived from Crossbow Technologies after it was acquired by Moog Inc. in 2011.
A company based in Tokyo, Japan specializing in the design and development of life science and research equipment including Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) Devices.
Manufacturer of measuring equipment and supplies, radiometers, and spectrometers. Founded in 1941. Combined with the Novanta company, JADAK, in 2016.

The CSD Facility maintains an array of specialised field equipment to support scientific coring and drilling. Facility equipment includes water samplers, soft sediment coring systems for most environmental settings, and lightweight drills for shallow rock coring. The CSD Facility is part of the University of Minnesota, School of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Funding for the CSD Facility is provided by the National Science Foundation, Division of Earth Sciences, Instrumentation and Facilities Program.
A polytechnic university and school of engineering founded in 1892.
A Canadian company established in 2010, headquartered in Kitchener, Ontario. Deep Trekker is a manufacturer and supplier of remotely operated vehicles (ROVs) for underwater monitoring.

A public research university whose largest and original campus is in Seattle, Washington, United States. Founded in 1861 as the Territorial University of Washington, it is one of the oldest universities on the West Coast. The university has three campuses: the oldest and largest in the University District of Seattle and two others in Tacoma and Bothell.

prefLabel: Magnavox Advanced Products and Systems Company
definition: A USA manufacturer founded in 1984, specialised in satellite navigation systems and military communication systems. The company was owned by Philips Electronics, and is no longer active.

A company based in Mountain View, California that conducts research , design, manufacturing and support of high frequency (HF) radar systems primarily for ocean current and wave monitoring. Founded in 1984.

A developer of seismic monitoring products for the land, marine and oil exploration markets. Founded in 1975 as Refraction Technology Inc, the brand Ref Tek was acquired by Trimble Navigation in 2012. In 2020, it returned to its engineering and customer service roots when it was purchased by Ref Tek Systems Inc, a subsidiary of Xeos Technologies Inc.

A company founded in 2000 in Enschede, Netherlands. Xsens is a supplier of 3D motion capture and inertial sensors. As of 2017, Xsens is now a brand of Movella, following Movella's (formerly mCube) acquisition of Xsens from ON Semiconductor in 2016.
Graco is an American manufacturer of fluid-handling systems and products based in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Founded in 1926.
A US based company specialising in the design and development of affordable marine robotics components and products. Founded in 2014 through Kickstarter.

The instrumentation group of SMRU, a marine science research organisation based at the University of St Andrews. This manufacturer specialises in the design and manufacture of marine animal mounted telemetry tags.
A US company based in Buena Park, California. StarDot Technologies is a designer and manufacturer of remote imaging and video solutions since 1994.

A company that designs and supplies sensors for measurement of heat transfer and thermal quantities such as solar radiation, heat flux and thermal conductivity. They also provide testing services, including material characterisation and calibration. The company is based in Delft, the Netherlands and was founded in 1993.

prefLabel: Ocean-Bottom Instrumentation Consortium (Universities of Durham and Southampton)
definition: A UK collaboration with partners at the Universities of Durham and Southampton, the Ocean-Bottom Instrumentation Consortium (OBIC) are contracted by the Natural Environment Research Council (NERC) to provide the Ocean-Bottom Instrumentation Facility (OBIF), as part of the NERC's Support and Facilities infrastructure support, as the third operational node of the Geophysical Equipment Facility. They supply, mobilise and operate instruments for use by NERC members, and continually upgrade and modify existing instruments.

A designer and manufacturer of instrumentation for environmental monitoring, plant growth and agricultural research since 1983. The company started on the Isle of Skye, Scotland and re-located to Wales in 1986.

A company that specialises in instruments that measure marine weather. The company was acquired by Jim Acquistapace and Bob Selig in 1969. In 2019, Davis Instruments became part of the Advanced Environmental Monitoring group.

A specialist technology company providing rental and sales services globally to the offshore marine sectors. Originally named Sonar Equipment Services (SES), the company re-branded to STR in February 2014 to better reflect the range of products and services supplied.

A US company founded in 1967 based in Boxborough, Massachusetts. Setra is now part of the Fortive group of companies. The company is a manufacturer of premium high accuracy pressure transducers, transmitters, capacitive pressure sensors, and acceleration sensing devices.

A manufacturer of scientific instruments for the scientific industry particularly chemical analysis equipment, with a focus on Information Rich Detection and Vacuum technology. It was founded in 1999 and purchased by Agilent Technologies in May 2010.

GEOMAR - Helmholtz Centre for Ocean Research Kiel is a research institute in Kiel, Germany. It was formed in 2004 by merging the Institute for Marine Science with the Research Center for Marine Geosciences (GEOMAR).

An American multinational technology company that specialises in specialty glass, ceramics, and related materials and technologies including advanced optics, primarily for industrial and scientific applications. Founded in 1851, the company was named Corning Glass Works until 1989.
Founded in 1995, Bettersize provides analytical instruments for material characterisation.

A US-based company founded in 1971, headquartered in Hillsboro, Oregon, specialising in the design and manufacturing of microscope technology. FEI is now a subsidary of Thermo Fisher Scientific following acquisition in 2016, becoming a part of Thermo Fisher's Analytical Instruments Segment.

A project that aims to unite the surfing community and the research community by developing oceanographic sensors integrated into surfboard fins. These are provided to researchers and citizen scientists surfers around the world at little to no cost.

A US-based company that develops, manufactures, markets, and sells data acquisition products, as well as complete systems for high-volume production and assembly testing. Keithley Instruments was founded in 1945 and merged with Tektronix Inc. in 2010.
A UK based company founded in 2006. It specialises in the design and manufacture of automatic cetacean monitoring equipment for use in a wide range of projects and environments.

A New Zealand-based company providing high-precision GPS and atomic clock time-keeping technologies and solutions for the smart grid and other industrial applications. The company was founded in 2002 and was acquired by Microchip Technology Incorporated in 2020.

A Teledyne Marine brand that designs and manufactures marine sensor platforms and unmanned surface vehicles. It was founded in 1998 as The Oceanscience Group Ltd. which was acquired by Teledyne in October 2014.

A US provider of semiconductor and system solutions for aerospace and defence, communications, data centre and industrial markets, founded in 1959. It acquired Symmetricom in 2013. It was itself acquired in 2018 by Microchip.
A UK based company providing products and bespoke or tailored solutions for positioning, navigation and timing applications. Established in 1987, the company is located in Heysham.
A manufacturing company founded in 1987 by George Hsu. It specialises in location and motion tracking sensor systems.

A German company owned by the Finnish corporation Wärtsillä following their acquisition of ELAC Nautik from L-3 Communications in 2015. Wärtsillä ELAC Nautik specialised in hydroacoustic systems for naval, hydrographic and commercial applications. Founded in 1926 as ELAC (Electroacustic GmbH).

Systron Donner Inertial manufactures navigation products including quartz MEMS (Micro Electro Mechanical) Gyroscopes, Accelerometers, Inertial Measurement Units (IMU) and GPS/ Inertial Navigation System (INS) products. Divisions of Systron Donner became part BEI technologies in 1995 before evolving into Systron Donner Inertial in 2002. It was acquired by EMCORE in 2019.
A Canadian research and ocean observing facility hosted and owned by the University of Victoria, and managed by the not-for-profit ONC Society.
A public land-grant research university with its main campus in Athens, Georgia, United States. Chartered in 1785, it is one of the oldest public universities in the United States.

A Moog Inc. company that provides sensors and tools for Remotely Operated Underwater Vehicles (ROV) and Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (AUVs). Established in 1991, Tritech was founded by Richard Marsh and Dick Wright, beginning operations as a two-man outfit from a converted house in Kingswells, Aberdeenshire.
A UK-based company that designs and manufactures ultrasonic anemometers (wind sensors) for professional markets, principally the offshore wind turbine industry. Founded in 1981.

An underwater technology company headquartered in Florida, USA. The company specialises in creating innovative software and hardware solutions for subsea surveys, ROV operations, marine construction, port security, and dredging.

Founded in 1869, Ernst Leitz GmbH that originated from the Optical Institute founded by Karl Kellner in Wetzlar, Germany. It primarily manufactured optical equipment such as microscopes and cameras. In 1997, the corporation was divided into three independent companies; Leica Camera, Leica Geosystems and Leica Microsystems.

An international company that specialises in the development of climate and environmental measurement, particularly intelligent meteorological sensors for road systems and industrial applications. It was originally founded by Gotthilf Lufft in Stuttgart, Germany in 1873. It became part of the OTT Hydromet marketing group in 2016.

A German manufacturer of chemical analysers. It originated from a company called Heraeus in 1897 that developed furnaces, quartz glassware and precious metal chemicals for elemental analysis in Hanau, Germany. Isoprime Ltd. Became a member of the elementargroup in 2008.
A developer of high-tech leak detection and condition monitoring systems for subsea installations within the oil and gas industry. Based in Norway, founded in 1999.
A UK-based company founded in 1985 specialising in the manufacturing of isotope ratio analysis instrumentation. The rights to the Europa product line were bought by Sercon Ltd in 2004.

A marine science research organisation that was established in 1978 by the Natural Environment Research Council (NERC) when the Seals Research Division and Whale Research Unit merged. Originally based in Cambridge, SMRU moved to the University of St Andrews in 1996.

Bellamare LLC is an engineering company that designs subsea instruments for the oceanographic, offshore, and aquaculture industries. They design underwater tools for subsea monitoring and intervention, and help marine scientists achieve their research goals by providing custom designed field and laboratory equipment, tailored to client specific demands.

prefLabel: Ifremer - Detection, Sensors and Metrology Laboratory
definition: A laboratory within the Unit of Technology Research and Development (RDT) and Department of Physical Resources and Deep-Sea Ecosystems (REM) at the French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea (Ifremer). It is responsible for developing new solutions for marine instruments or in situ measurement sensors, new methods for inhibiting biofilms and marine fouling, and new techniques for chemical and physical analysis.

prefLabel: National Ocean Sciences Accelerator Mass Spectrometry Facility (NOSAMS)
definition: A US-based facility founded at the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute (WHOI) in 1989, headquartered in Woods Hole, Massachusetts, aimed with making radiocarbon measurements accessible to the ocean and earth sciences community, develop measurement capabilities, and serve as an educational and outreach source.

A specialist in wind Lidar technology, providing precise remote wind measurements for onshore and offshore wind energy projects. Founded in 2007 and headquartered in Ledbury, England, ZX Lidars is part of the Fred. Olsen Ltd. group.

A Marine geophysical-geotechnical service delivery company specializing in high resolution 3D acoustic imaging solutions to mitigate risk in offshore installations by imaging and identifying geohazards in the seabed and providing detailed soil stratigraphy. PanGeo Subsea Inc. is a privately held Canadian company established in 2006.

Consilium Middle East is a subsidiary company of Consilium Marine AB, Sweden, established in 2000. It primarily develops products and systems for the Oil and Gas and Marine industries. Consilium also produces fire detection equipment for transport (e.g. trains) and high-value buildings such as hospitals, airports and museums.

prefLabel: Hydro-Optics, Biology and Instrumentation Laboratories, Inc.
definition: A US-based company specialised in sponsored research and instrument manufacturing. HOBI Labs' main products include spectral optical backscattering, fluorescence and attenuation sensors designed for natural water measurements, as well as hyperspectral radiometers. HOBI Labs was founded in 1997 and ceased operations in 2014; since then, a separate company called Hobi Instrument Services has been providing calibration, repair and limited sales of HOBI Labs instruments.
A manufacturer of core sampling systems based in the Netherlands.
A company founded in 2006 in Oslo, Norway and now headquartered in Reppenstedt, Germany. Franatech specialises in the development, production, and supply of underwater sensors for dissolved gases.

A US-based company that specialises in the design and manufacture of autonomous instruments that measure marine and freshwater inorganic carbon parameters pCO2 (partial pressure of carbon dioxide) and pH using patented drift-free technology. It was founded in 1999.
Manufacturer and designer of marine equipment, known for the creation of a seabed classifier instrument, RoxAnn. Founded in 1987 and dissolved in 1999.

A US-based company specialising in instruments for remote environments, particularly maritime applications. RMRCO provide special instrument design in additional to peripheral hardware for network installations.
A company specialising in the design of multibeam echosounders. The company was founded in Texas, USA in 2006.

A french multinational company that designs and builds electrical systems, providing services for the aerospace, defence, security, and transportation industries. The company is headquartered in Paris, and was founded in 2000.

An American company that manufactures Precision Light Sources, Light Measurement Instrumentation, UV Transmittance Analysers, Meteorological Instrumentation, OEM Instrumentation, and over 135 different types of Sensors. They provide a wide array of services, including accelerated UV materials testing, NIST-traceable spectroradiometric analyses, reflectance and spectral transmittance testing, and calibrations for light meters and light sources. They were founded in 1967.

A commercial company that operates within the Honeywell International Inc. enterprise. It specialises in avionics, aircraft engines, flight management systems, and service solutions to manufacturers, airlines, airport operations, militaries, and space programs.

Metek Meteorologische Messtechnik, Germany, offers a wide range of high-end meteorological instrumentation starting with a family of sonic anemometers and variants of versatile data loggers. Ground based remote sensing techniques provide profiles of wind, temperature, rain rate and cloud droplets in continuous unattended operation. The company was founded in 1989.
A US biotechnology company founded in 2012 in Pleasanton California. 10x Genomics designs and manufactures gene sequencing technology with applications in scientific research.

A french company that manufactures oceanographic loggers, multiparameter probes and autonomous monitoring stations that measure the physico-chemical parameters of fresh and sea water to monitor the environment and water quality. Founded in 1984.

A developer and manufacturer of a wide range of electrochemical sensors for use in industry, water management and laboratory analysis. Sensortechnik Meinsberg GmbH emerged in 1990 from the production area of Meinsberg research institute which was founded in 1945. Nova Analytics took over Sensortechnik Meinsberg GmbH in 2006, which was then integrated into ITT Analytics in 2010. In 2011, the Fluid Technology division of the ITT Group, to which Sensortechnik Meinsberg GmbH belongs, became the independent, listed company Xylem. Since 2016, Sensortechnik Meinsberg operates as Xylem Analytics Germany Sales GmbH and Co. KG.

Part of the Observator Group founded in the Netherlands in 1924, Observator Instruments is the US-based meteorological and hydrological division, responsible for the development of the Obsermet product line (anemometers, rain gauges, data loggers, displays, etc.). The division was founded in Santa Ana, California in 1985.
A developer and manufacturer of scientific instrumentation for monitoring carbonaceous aerosols in the air. It is based in Ljubljana, Slovenia and founded in 2007 by the company Magee Scientific.
A Spanish company specialised in the design, development and manufacture of instruments and equipment for aquatic ecosystem research.

A German company based in Rastede, originating in 1998 as a spin-off from the University of Oldenburg. TriOS specialises in the design and manufacture of instruments for radiometric and fluorometric water analysis.

The Centre for Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture Science (Cefas) is a UK based centre for applied marine and freshwater science and research. It incorporates Cefas Technology Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of Cefas that specialises in the in-house development and application of Cefas technology to meet the needs of customers in the public and private marine sector, both nationally and internationally.
A developer and manufacturer of measuring and analysis devices, simulation devices and automatic sampling systems. iSiTEC was founded in Bremerhaven in 1996.
A manufacturer of bio-geochemical/physical oceanographic sampling and profiling instruments, founded in 1983 in the United States of America.

A company that designs and manufactures high-tech solutions for subsurface exploration, structural monitoring, defence and underwater acoustics applications. Founded in 1956 under the name SMEG, Sercel took on its current name in 1962. Headquartered in Nantes (France), Sercel operates worldwide and employs more than 1500 people.
The French Research Institute for Exploitation of the Sea, Ifremer is a marine research and technology institution based in Brest, France. Founded in 1984.

Austrian based Anton paar develops, produces and distributes laboratory instruments and process measuring systems, and provides custom-tailored automation and robotic solutions in the field of rheometry. Anton Paar GmbH is owned by the charitable Santner Foundation and was founded in 1932.

A developer and manufacturer of high quality electromagnetic (EM) sensors for the geophysical industry. Since its foundation in 2008, the company has transferred into a joint venture by Houston, Texas based KMS Technologies in the US.

A UK company based in North Wales specialising in high-end mass spectrometers. Founded in 1995, the company joined AMETEK in July 2016 and became a business unit of the AMETEK Materials Analysis Division.
Olympus is a Japanese manufacturer of optical and digital precision technology for medical systems, digital cameras and scientific applications. It is a global corporation that was founded in 1919.

The Sartorius group is an international pharmaceutical and laboratory equipment supplier, covering the segments of Bioprocess Solutions and Lab Products and Services. Founded in 1870 in Gottingen, Germany.

A US-based company specialising in high quality temperature instruments with a variety of medical and scientific applications. Thermco was founded in 2007 and is headquartered in Lafayette, New Jersey, United States.
A medical technology company that originated in the United States in 1897. It is also known as BD or Becton Dickinson.

prefLabel: WISE Group Automasjon and Data AS
definition: A leading provider of meteorological and oceanographic data systems. They specialise in designing, building, and installing Environmental Monitoring Systems (EMS) and Helideck Monitoring Systems (HMS) for offshore and marine applications. Their systems measure parameters like wind, temperature, barometric pressure, sea currents, and waves, ensuring safety and efficiency in demanding environments. Headquartered in Stavanger area, Norway, it was founded in 1991.

A US based manufacturer and designer of underwater video cameras, underwater lights, rugged pan and tilt units, and video inspection systems for oceanographic, military, and nuclear purposes. Founded in 1975.

Manufacturers of underwater optical sensors. The instruments are designed for in-situ measurements in fresh and salt waters including extreme of conditions, and for in-line industrial applications. Founded in 1994.

A company that specialises in manufacturing hydrophones and data acquisition instrumentation for use by the Navy and worldwide seismic community. High Tech products and systems have been selected to meet the stringent requirements of military applications including Anti-Submarine Warfare, Propulsion Noise Test Systems, Torpedo Testing, Marine Ambient Noise, Arctic Noise Monitoring and Surveillance. Founded and incorporated in the state of Mississippi in 1989.

A manufacturer of advanced systems for ambient air, laboratory analysis, and point-source mercury monitoring, with expertise in cold vapor atomic fluorescence detection for measuring ultra-trace levels of mercury. Tekran serves the needs of industry, government and research institutions with applications ranging from pure research to primary manufacturing. Founded in Toronto, Canada in 1989.
A Canadian based company that develops patented holographic technology to create microscopes for research and discovery.
A French company founded in 1963 that specialises in underwater sediment traps, ADCP structures, bottom mounted instruments, sampling bottles, frames and surface buoys.

A US-based company specialised in hydroacoustic technologies for monitoring and assessing aquatic resources. BioSonics was founded in 1978 in Seattle, Washington (USA) by Bill Acker, a former Professor of Engineering at the University of Washington. BioSonics instruments were first utilised by the local scientific community for fisheries research; today, its technologies serve a wide range of costumers worldwide for the monitoring of biological and physical features in any aquatic environment.
Analytical Sciences Ltd, based near Cheltenham, England, UK designs and manufactures laboratory instrumentation for the analysis and automated preparation and handling of liquid (aqueous) samples.
A company that specialises in developing global positioning products and technologies for geo-businesses and geospatial industries. It was founded in the 1980s in Japan.
A company specialising in the manufacture of glass and glass-ceramics. It is headquartered in Mainz, Germany. Founded in founded in Jena, Germany in 1884.

prefLabel: Royal Netherlands Institute For Sea Research
definition: The national oceanographic institute and the Netherlands' centre of expertise for ocean, sea and coast. Areas of research include marine systems, the way they change, the role they play in climate and biodiversity, and how they may provide sustainable solutions to society in the future. NIOZ also maintains and operates a variety of seagoing equipment as part of their National Marine Facilities.

A British company specialised in the development, manufacture and integration of weather satellite and remote sensing ground stations. Products include specialised software for data ingestion, processing and display.

A Danish manufacturer founded in Stovring, Denmark in 1979, specialised in development and manufacturing of maritime communication and navigation equipment. Shipmate was acquired by Norwegian Simrad in 1994, after which all products were marketed under SIMRAD Shipmate. In 1996, SIMRAD was acquired by the large Norwegian Kongsberg group and then in 2005 went to Navico. Navico stopped all activities in Stovring in 2007.
A UK based manufacturer and designer of marine sensors. They are specialised in in-situ water-quality measurement sensors. Founded in 2019.

A company founded in 1971 in California, USA. ESE specialises in digital clocks and timers, digital multi-meters, digital frequency counters, and more recently GPS master clocks, with applications in a variety of fields, including the broadcast, communication and military industries.
A company that distributes professional equipment, such as drafting instruments, laboratory equipment, and scientific instruments. Founded in 1981.
Manufacturers of underwater optical sensors.

An engineering and software design company that provides a wide range of services for Government agencies, industry and academia, primarily in the defense, transport and energy sectors. Founded in 1969 in the UK.

An Austrian company specialised in the development and manufacture of sensors and calibration systems for a range of atmospheric parameters, and in providing calibration services from its accredited laboratory. The company was founded in 1979, and has since established offices worldwide.

A US-based designer and manufacturer of global satellite positioning services, having delivered the first commercial Precise Point Positioning (PPP) service. It was later incorporated into C&C Technologies, which in 2015 was acquired by Oceaneering International Inc.

A Canadian company founded in 1997, headquartered in Richmond, British Columbia. Point Grey specialises in the design and manufacturing of digital cameras for industrial, scientific, medical, traffic, and security applications.

A company that develops, manufactures and markets instruments and related consumables and services for use in drug discovery and other life sciences research, such as basic human disease research, genetic analysis and biotechnology. It was acquired by PerkinElmer in 2003.

A manufacturer of underwater acoustic systems (releases for heavy lift, transponders, and surface equipment) and oceanographic instrumentation (current meters, tide gauges, and sound velocimeters), the company provides technical and offshore support in these fields. The United Kingdom division of Mors Environment is Oceano Instruments.

prefLabel: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution and Star Engineering
definition: A developmental collaboration between WHOI and Star Engineering Inc., a provider of Printed Circuit Board Assemblies, Cable Assemblies and Mechanical Box Build Assemblies.
A Canadian company providing oceanographic, acoustic, remote sensing and ice research products, equipment leasing, and scientific consulting services.
LI-COR develops environmental and biotechnology products. It was founded in 1971. It was previously called Lambda Instruments Corporation. It was acquired by Battery Ventures in 2021.

An academic institution located at the University of California, San Diego. It specialises in the biological, physical, chemical, geological, geophysical and climate studies of the oceans and earth. It was originally founded in 1903 as the Marine Biological Association of San Diego, before it was merged with the University in California in 1912 (Scripps Institution for Biological Research). It changed its name to the Scripps Institution of Oceanography in 1925. It maintains several oceanographic research vessels including the RV Roger Revelle.

A subsidiary company of Lockheed Martin that was formed in 2004 from a merger between Lockheed Martin and Sippican Holdings Inc. It specialises in oceanographic and meteorological instrumentation, underwater vehicles, countermeasure, sea-air, and data acquisition systems.
An instrument manufacturing company that specialises in industrial process measurement. It was founded in 1921 by Ludwig Krohn as LUDWIG KROHNE and SOHN.

A British manufacturing company founded in 1990 that specialises in the measurement of oceanographic and process parameters including temperature, depth, turbidity, suspended sediment, motion, orientation, cathodic protection, subsea leaks and marine mammal activity, as well as through and above water data communication systems. Other areas of expertise include consultancy, systems integration and real time monitoring systems. The company is headquartered in Basingstoke.

A US-based company with offices worldwide, specialising in the design, manufacture and distribution of tracking and telemetry systems for use in aquatic ecosystems. Founded in 2014, InnovaSea acquired Vemco and HTI in 2019.

A manufacturing company based in Germany that was founded in April 2004. It is a manufacturer of electrochemical measuring and calibration devices for the use in laboratories, industrial applications, research and development and for environmental monitoring in natural waters.

A Japanese multinational corporation headquartered in Ota, Tokyo, specialising in the production of optical, imaging and industrial products, such as lenses, cameras, medical equipment, scanners, printers, and semiconductor manufacturing equipment. Founded in 1933.

The International Coucil for Exploration of the Sea is a regional fishery advisory body and the world's oldest intergovernmental science organisation. ICES is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, where its multinational secretariat staff of 51 provide scientific, administrative and secretarial support to the ICES community. It was established in 1902 in Copenhagen.

A UK based company specialising in marine surveys, data analysis and consultancy. They also offer marine survey equipment for hire covering a wide spectrum of offshore marine, coastal and aerial applications. Founded in 2013.
A US based based company providing particle sizer instruments to scientific laboratories. Cilas now longer trades but CPS US now provide support for Cilas instruments.

A manufactuer of dynamic pressure, force, torque and acceleration technology for industry and scientific research. Their headquarters are based in Switzerland, but have other locations globally. Founded in the 1960s.
A company that manufactured elemental analysers. Now CE Instruments, part of ThermoFisher.

Coastal Environmental Systems was a designer and manufacturer of weather station hardware and software used in applications such as aviation weather, hazardous materials, transportation, and military. It was founded in 1981 and acquired by Campbell Scientific in 2016.
Founded in 1997, Leica Microsystems GmbH is a manufacturer of optical microscopic equipment. It is a successor company of Ernst Leitz that was founded in Germany in 1869.
A Norwegian manufacturer of navigation echosounders, speed logs and echosounders for merchant, fishing and navy purposes. The company was established in 1973 and is situated in Oslo.
A manufacturer of ocean sensing and exploration tools for ocean enthusiasts, industry, and conservation. The company was founded in 2016 and is based in San Francisco, California, United States.

QIAGEN (formerly Diagen) offer molecular testing solutions, from DNA, RNA, and protein extraction from biological samples, to testing technologies targeting single or multiple molecular variants, and software to analyse and interpret molecular data to deliver valuable insights. With headquarters in Dusseldorf, Germany it was founded in 1984.

A Japanese company founded as Tokyo Telecommunications Engineering Corporation in 1946, and renamed as Sony Corporation in 1958. Sony is headquartered in Tokyo - Japan and designs and manufactures a wide range of products from audio and visual recording and reproducing devices, to computers and robotics.

A designer and manufacturer of reliable and accurate water monitoring systems and instruments for oceanographic and limnologic use, including instruments for high resolution measurement of electrical conductivity, temperature, dissolved oxygen, pressure, fluorescence, and PAR concentration in water. Founded in 1982.
A US-based subsidary of Keller Pressure, based in Newport News, Virginia. Keller America specialises in the design and manufacturing of pressure sensors.

A supplier and manufacturer of camera technology and image capture solutions for industrial inspection, medical and scientific imaging, traffic monitoring, among other applications. Founded in 1989 in Stadtroda, Germany, it is a subsidiary of TKH Technologie Deutschland AG.

An Icelandic company founded in 1985, responsible for the manufacture of miniature sensors and data loggers used in aquatic research.An Icelandic company founded in 1985, responsible for the manufacture of miniature sensors and data loggers used in aquatic research.
A company that specialises in bioacoustics monitoring technologies for scientists, researchers, and government agencies internationally. The company was founded by Ian Agranat in 2003.

Carl Zeiss AG, branded as ZEISS, is a German manufacturer of optical systems and optoelectronics, founded in Jena, Germany in 1846 by optician Carl Zeiss. ZEISS Group develops, produces and distributes measuring technology, microscopes, medical technology, eyeglass lenses, camera and cinema lenses, binoculars and semiconductor manufacturing equipment.

A family business based in Tiefgraben, Austria, specialised in the manufacture and distribution of sediment and water sampling equipment. The company was started by Richard Niederreiter in 1991, and taken over by his sons Daniel and Martin Niederreiter in 2020.

EdgeTech is a manufacturer of underwater technology solutions. Its products include: side scan sonars, sub-bottom profilers, bathymetry systems, AUV and ROV-based sonar systems, combined and customized solutions. In addition to the full line of underwater survey products, EdgeTech provides reliable USBL systems, transponder beacons, deep sea acoustic releases, shallow water and long life acoustic releases, MRUs and customized underwater acoustic command and control systems. The company traces its history back to 1965 when it started out as a division of EG&G Marine Instruments. In 1995, EdgeTech became a private company. In 2012 ORE Offshore, a leading provider of acoustic releases, transponders and USBL systems, adopted the EdgeTech name after over ten years operating as an affiliate organization within the company. The company also has a comprehensive suite of in-house testing facilities including test pools, acoustic test tanks, pressure test chambers and two company research vessels used for testing and sea trials. These facilities allow the companies to fully test and calibrate every system.

A Swiss sales distributor owned by Polytechnic Marine. Polytechnic Marine were a small company owned by a UK military electronics company called Smiths PLC. Navstar S.A. appears to have been dissolved in 2008.

Manufacturer of survey echosounders, radar and radio navigation equipment, and provider of integrated hydrographic and oceanographic system solutions. Was founded in 2003. Acquired by Teledyne Reson in 2014.
A Canadian company that specialises in magnetic sensors for marine environments that was founded in 1998.

An international engineering company based in Connecticut, USA, founded in 1962. The company specialises in instrumentation, primarily for the measurement of temperature, pressure, humidity, and flow and level. In addition to this the company designs and manufactures data loggers and recorders.
A University based in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA. Founded in 1851.
The instrument, sensor or device has been developed and/or manufactured using bespoke materials and/or designs and is not traceable to a specific manufacturer or organisation.
A Tasmanian-based company providing specialised oceanographic and water quality instrumentation. It was founded in 1991.
USA-based manufacturer of video encoding and IP camera systems. Headquartered in Lincoln, Nebraska with engineering offices in Chicago, Illinois. Founded in 2008.

Gems designs and manufactures a broad portfolio of liquid level, flow switches and pressure switches, sensors and transducers, miniature solenoid valves, and pre-assembled fluidic systems. Founded in 1955, Gems Sensors is a division of Fortive Corporation.

An Italian-based company that develops, manufactures and sells automatic wet chemistry analysers for environmental and industrial markets. Founded in 1988, the company has additional offices in China, India and Germany.
A UK-based company specialising in the production of high-speed imaging and analysis instruments that photograph plankton in the size range 100 micron to 20 mm in water.

A global company, headquartered in Greifensee, Switzerland that manufactures precision instruments for use in laboratory, industrial, and food retailing applications. Founded as Mettler Toledo Inc. in 1992.

A global company that is a brand of the Processing Sensing Technologies (PST) group. It develops and manufactures solutions for measuring and monitoring relative humidity, temperature, CO2, differential pressure, pressure, flow, dew point and water activity. It was founded in 1965 and is headquartered in Switzerland.
A US-based marine research and engineering institution founded in 1930.
An instruments manufacturer for thermal technology, civil engineering and diagnostic screening systems. It was founded in 1950 in Finland as Wallac Oy. It became part of PerkinElmer.
A US-based company that manufactures and supplies instruments for the measurement of solar and atmospheric irradiance. Founded in Newport, Rhode Island in the US in 1917.
A Swiss-based globally operating process and laboratory instrumentation and automation supplier. Founded in 1953 as L Hauser KG, it began operating as Endress+Hauser in 1957.

A Norwegian company founded in 1995, headquartered in Trondheim. NORBIT Subsea specialise in the supply of underwater instrumentation and communication solutions, in particular wide-band multibeam sonar.

prefLabel: University of Cantabria, Environmental Hydraulics Institute
definition: A Spanish-based joint research institute between the University of Cantabria and the Government of Spain, focused on the sciences and technologies related to the water cycle. Founded in 2007.
Based in Lymington, UK, Gill Instruments Ltd supplies ultrasonic anemometers for wind speed and direction measurement, along with wind accessories.

A UK and US-based company specialising in the design, development and manufacture of advanced quadrupole mass spectrometers for vacuum, gas, plasma, and surface science. Founded in 1981 in Warrington, the United Kingdom, Hiden Analytical also has regional headquarters in Livonia, Michigan, United States.

A designer and manufacturer of remote ultra-low power dataloggers and data collection platforms for the acquisition and transmission of data and images, compatible with many sensors for the measurement of all types of meteorological, hydrological, physical and environmental parameters. Founded in 1974.

PANalytical was a manufacturer of analytical instrumentation and software for X-ray diffraction (XRD) and X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF). The materials characterization equipment is used for scientific research and development, for industrial process control applications and for semiconductor metrology. PANalytical, formerly Philips Analytical, was founded in 1948 and merged with Malvern Instruments Ltd. On the 1st of January 2017 to form Malvern Panalytical. Its headquarters were in Almelo, The Netherlands, with application laboratories established in Japan, China, the USA and The Netherlands.

An ultrasonic sensor technology company specialising in the design and manufacture of high-performance ultrasonic transducers and sensors. Founded in 1982 and headquartered in Milford, New Hampshire, their products are widely used in marine, industrial, and commercial applications, including fish-finding transducers, weather stations, and flow sensors.

A research and technology centre based in Geesthact, Germany. Scientific spectrum encompasses high-performance materials, processes and environmentally friendly technologies for mobility and new energy systems. Research is conducted on biomaterials for medicine and increasing quality of life. Hereon addresses the challenges of climate change and facilitates sustainable management of coasts and the marine environment. Founded in 1956.

A company that designs and manufactures data loggers and monitoring solutions which are used to measure, record, and manage data for improving the environment and preserving the quality of temperature-sensitive products. Their HOBO data logger and weather station products are used around the world in a broad range of monitoring applications, from verifying the performance of green buildings and renewable energy systems to agricultural and coastal research. It was founded in 1981.

A Teledyne Marine brand that specialises in neutrally buoyant, autonomous drifters and profilers, autonomous underwater gliding vehicles and moored underwater sound sources. It is notable for the APEX (Autonomous Profiling Explorer) profiling float and Slocum Glider.

A German based developer and manufacturer of mechanical samplers for limnology and oceanography. Founded in 1927 as 'Walter Schweder Precision Engineering', the company became 'HYDRO-BIOS Apparatebau GmbH' in 1960. In 1963, Hans Fischer joined the company and the company re-located to Kiel-Altenholz.

Ship Motion Control (SMC) manufactures motion reference units for the marine and offshore oil and gas industry. The roll, pitch and heave motion reference units are used in dynamic positioning, active heave compensation, helideck monitoring system, and hydrographic applications. SMC also produces software systems for motion monitoring, helideck monitoring system and weather and met-ocean monitoring on-board offshore platforms and vessels. SMC was established in 2003 and is based out of Gzira, Malta.
A manufacturing company that specialises in satellite navigation and heading technology in the agricultural, marine, surveying, GIS mapping, and machine control markets. It was founded in 2013.

A company providing equipment for groundwater, surface water, soil monitoring and data collection telemetry solutions. Founded in 1982, they have offices in the UK, New Zealand, Spain and South Africa.
A Japanese technology company that manufactures and distributes radio communication equipment. Founded in 1915.
A German based manufacturer of application-oriented laboratory instruments for sample preparation and particle sizing. Founded in 1920.

A Japanese company based in Nishinomiya that manufactures and sells measuring instruments, water level gauges, and other diagnostic equipment. It was established in 1973 and is a subsidiary of Kawasaki Steel, now known as JFE Steel.

The Canadian subsidiary of Kongsberg Maritime. It manufactures underwater acoustic instrumentation, supplying a global customer base for a wide range of applications. It started out in Vancouver in 1973, and was acquired by Simrad in 1996.

A US-based company specialising in the design and construction of high quality oceanographic imaging systems for both shallow and deep water applications. The Ocean Imaging Systems product line began in 2002 but some imaging products were originally designed by Benthos Inc. and have been redesigned and updated. OIS is a division of EP Oceanographic LLC.
A company that specialises in developing fluorometers for environmental and industrial uses. It was founded in 1972.

A US company founded in California in 1992. SonTek was acquired by YSI in 2001, and in 2011 YSI merged with the analytics division of IIT Corp to form a new water company trading under Xylem. SonTek primarily manufactures acoustic doppler current profiling (ADCP) instrumentation for water velocity measurement in water body and laboratory settings.

Formerly known as Hanwha Techwin. A global vision solution provider providing optical design, image processing and cybersecurity technologies including IP cameras that support up to 8K resolution, video management systems, video and audio analytics, multi-sensor technologies, and device integration with a host of 3rd party application providers. These surveillance solutions are used globally, across a range of industries including retail, transportation, education, banking, healthcare, hospitality etc.

A company focused on analytical instruments, lab technologies, diagnostic testing, laboratory services, informatics and cord blood banking. It was founded in 1937 by Richard Perkin and Charles Elmer in Manhattan, US.
A term to describe the acquisition relationship between Symmetricom and Microsemi. Symmetricom was a manufacturer of time synchronisation and timing technology. It was acquired by Microsemi in 2013.

Sage Science develops products to streamline and improve sample preparation workflows for DNA and protein analysis for the life sciences research markets. Founded in 2005 in Beverly, Massachusetts, United States.

A manufacturer of dissolved gas sensors. It was established from research in the Oceanography Department at Dalhousie University in 1998, which resulted in the GTD-Pro. Its headquarters are in Nova Scotia, Canada.
A US-based company founded in 1976, headquartered in Fort Collins, Colorado, specialising in the development of water monitoring instrumentation and software.
A Canadian manufacturer of SVPs, CTDs, and underway profiling systems for hydrographers and oceanographers that was established in 1974.

Smart Radio Holdings Limited (formerly Shenzhen Yuantong Telecom Co. Ltd) is a designer and manufacturer of radio communication products for marine AIS, radio telemetry, data, voice, and video communications. It was founded in 2000.

A US company founded in 1998 in San Diego, California. Insite Pacific manufactures and supplies a range of advanced video systems, designed for underwater applications and available in underwater housings operating to full ocean depth.

A Canadian company based in Clarenville, Newfoundland and founded in 2010. SubC Imaging specialises in subsea imaging equipment and software for marine research, offshore oil and gas, aquaculture, and fisheries.
A US based manufacturer and designer specialising in subsea and hazardous area video monitoring. Established in 2010, from SIDUS Solutions Inc., which was founded in 2000.

A manufacturing company in the United States which specialises in technologies for submersible and field measurements of particles and particle size distributions that was founded in 1995. The company is particularly notable for using laser diffraction technology, producing the LISST (Laser In-Situ Scattering and Transmissometry) series of measuring devices.
K.U.M. Umwelt- und Meerestechnik Kiel GmbH is a German engineering company specialising in marine services and equipment for research.

A company based in Bellevue, Washington, US, that designs and manufactures imaging sonars. The companys line of products can be deployed from vessels, ROVs (remotely operated vehicles), AUVs (autonomous underwater vehicles) and by divers. Founded in 2002.

A global manufacturer of environmental data loggers and data-acquisition systems, measurement and control products. It was founded in 1974 in Utah, U.S. by Eric and Evan Campbell. The first product marketed was the Model CA9 Path Averaging Laser Anemometer, which was developed for the U.S. Army, White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico.

A UK-based company founded in 1946, headquartered in Amersham, Buckinghamshire, specialising in the manufacturing of medical technology. Amersham is now a part of General Electric Healthcare Technologies Inc. following acquisition in 2003. Medical technology is still produced by GE Healthcare under the brand name of Amersham.

The HORIBA Group of worldwide companies provides an extensive array of instruments and systems for applications ranging from automotive R and D, process and environmental monitoring, in-vitro medical diagnostics, semiconductor manufacturing and metrology, to a broad range of scientific R and D and QC measurements.

A UK-based electronics, defence and communications company founded in 1917 as The Plessey Company. The company developed many specialist sub-divisions with many overseas bases. The San Diego division later became Plessey Environmental Systems, which was bought out by Grundy in 1980.

A company of the Orolia group since 2007. Spectracom was originally founded in Rochester, New York USA in 1972. It is a manufacturer of precision time and frequency instruments and network-centric equipment used in a wide range of industries.
A US based global aerospace and defense contractor and industrial corporation. The company researches, develops and manufactures advanced technology products, and was founded in 1922.
A marine science research and technology institution based on two sites in Southampton and Liverpool, United Kingdom.
A US company that specialises in developing products and technologies for fisheries. It was founded in 1992.

A designer and manufacturer of sampling equipment including box coring and multi-coring equipment worldwide, specialising in custom design and manufacture of marine equipment, miscellaneous sampling devices, and associated hardware and housings. Founded in 1947.
A French manufacturer of fully integrated robotics systems that include subsea engineering, robotics and autonomy, and visual intelligence solutions. Founded in 2016.

Founded in 1992 by the Czech National Council as the Czech successor of the former Czechoslovak Academy of Sciences. The academy is the leading non-university public research institution in the Czech Republic. It conducts both fundamental and strategic applied research. It has three scientific divisions, namely the Division of Mathematics, Physics, and Earth Sciences, Division of Chemical and Life Sciences, and Division of Humanities and Social Sciences.

An American company headquartered in California, originating in 1976. Applied Physics Systems specialises in the design and manufacture of high-performance magnetometers, directional and gamma sensors and complete Measurement While Drilling (MWD) systems, primarily for use in the oil and gas industry, horizontal directional drilling (HDD) and other scientific applications.

A Swedish company established in 1912 specialising in the design and manufacturing of speed loggers. The marine and safety business area of the company was created in 2009. Consilium Marine and Safety AB now specialises in fire and gas detection, safety management and environmental monitoring systems for marine vessels.

A German company specialising in the development and supply of meteorological and other environmental measuring technology, for the weather forecasting and agricultural sectors, as well for air travel and the emergency services. Founded in 1945.

prefLabel: Theodor Friedrichs & Co. Meteorologische Geräte und Systeme GmbH
definition: A German company which specialises in the design and manufacture of meteorological sensors and systems, and test equipment for meteorological sensor calibration. The company was founded in 1953 in Schenefeld near Hamburg. In March 2022 parts of the company were taken over by the company METEK Meteorologische Messetechnik GmbH.

A Canadian company which provides consulting and research services for assessing and mitigating underwater noise. The company originates in 1981, and specialises in developing and implementing acoustic technologies with applications in the energy, fisheries and defence sectors.
A manufacturing subsidiary of Kongsberg that specialises in navigation; seismic spread; and onshore and space-based systems. It was founded in 1984.

A company based in Delft, Netherlands, that develops, assembles and distributes instruments for measuring solar radiation parameters to monitor atmospheric properties for scientific purposes and renewable energy applications. It started out in the same city in 1830 as a pharmacy shop named 'Kipp' after its funder Petrus Jacobu Kipp. The company was re-named 'Kipp & Zonen', meaning 'Kipp and sons', when Kipp's sons took over the business in 1866. The company extended its specialisation to telephones and accessories for railway companies, until the first promotion of the thermopile in 1923; this marked Kipp & Zonen's shift towards solar radiation instruments, which persists to this day.
A Canadian designer and manufacturer of oceanographic instruments, including sensors, loggers and compact systems.

A Teledyne Marine brand, that specialises in Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCPs). It manufactures solutions for current profiling, wave measurement and precision underwater navigation applications. It was founded in 1982.

A subsidiary of the Kongsberg Maritime that specialises in electronic equipment for professional fish-finding and underwater research such as hydrographic echo sounders. It was established in 1946 as Simrad Yachting.
A Japanese electronics company specialising in the manufacture and distribution of marine electronics systems, radar systems, fish finders and navigational instruments. Founded in 1938.

An American, publicly traded company, founded in 1983, that designs, manufactures, and sells analog and mixed-signal integrated circuits. Maxim Integrated develops integrated circuits for the automotive, industrial, communications, consumer, and computing markets.

A British organisation that enables research in the polar regions. It originated from the Falkland Islands Dependencies Survey (FIDS), and was renamed the British Antarctic Survey (BAS) in 1962. It became part of the Natural Environmental Research Council (NERC) in 1967. It is based in Cambridge, UK and operates research centres in the Antarctic, South Georgia and Arctic, research ships, research aircraft and various specialised vehicles and equipment.

A German company that manufactures underwater technologies, subsea solutions and ocean monitoring systems to science and industries such as offshore oil and gas. The company specialises in Li-Ion batteries, pCO2 analysers and system solutions. It was founded by Dipl.-Phys. Stefan Marx in 2010.

An international high-technology group, that designs, develops and manufactures aircraft engines, rocket engines as well as various aerospace and defense-related equipment and their components. It was formed by a merger between SNECMA and the defense electronics specialist SAGEM in 2005. Headquarters are based in Paris, France.
A Canadian company providing monitoring solutions and equipment for seismic monitoring and research, with offices in Ottawa, Calgary, Beijing and Houston. Founded in 1986.

A research-orientated company founded in 1977 that specialises in the manufacture of scientific instrumentation and environmental monitoring, in particular, high quality optical instruments for the oceanographic, atmospheric, water quality, and biological sciences communities.
A subsidiary company of the Sparton Corporation formed in 1930. At the time, the Sparton Corporation was formally known as Sparks-Withington.

A Canadian company that specialises in the design and manufacturing of echosounders for hydrographic survey and mapping, pre/post dredging survey, ship navigation, oceanographic research, and sub-bottom profiling of the sea bottom sediment layers. It was founded in 1981.

A Norwegian technology subsidiary of the Kongsberg Group. It delivers systems for positioning, surveying, navigation and automation to merchant vessels and offshore installations. It was formed in 1997, consisting of the following companies: Kongsberg Simrad, Kongsberg Norcontrol, Kongsberg Norcontrol Simulation and Simrad. It has around 4000 staff and operates in 20 countries.
A company that designed and manufactured vehicles and instruments for measuring ocean proporties, based in Marion, Massachusetts. In operation between the 1960s and 1980s.

Based in Aberdeen, UK, Teledyne TSS specialises in the design, manufacture and support of marine products for applications including navigation, motion compensation, platform stabilisation, and subsea pipe and cable survey. Founded in 1903 as S.G. Brown Ltd, it eventually merged with TSS to become TSS International. It was subsequently purchased by Teledyne in 2008.

A manufacturer and distributor of systems designed for the collection, identification and enumeration of zooplankton and microscopic sediment particles in both fresh and salt water, including the ZooSCAN, UVP and Nemo systems. Established in 2007.

A company based in Santa Clara, California (USA), specialised in developing and manufacturing analytical instruments, software and services for life sciences, diagnostics and chemical laboratories worldwide. It was established in 1999 as a corporate spin-off of the Hewlett-Packard Company (HP).
A British company that was situated in Richmond, Surrey and manufactured electrical measuring instruments. It specialised in pH meters and was active between 1939-2000.

A Dutch instrument manufacturer established in 1965. Skalar manufactures a range of automated chemistry analyzers i.e. for the environmental, pharmaceutical, agricultural, detergent, food and beverage laboratory with a worldwide sales, support and distribution.
A US-based company specialised in water sensing instrumentation for use in environmental monitoring. The company is a subsidiary of Xylem Inc. and was founded in Ohio, USA in 1948.

A UK-based, global company that designs and manufactures underwater acoustic positioning, inertial navigation, wireless communications and sonar technology systems. It was founded in 1971 by John Partridge. It is headquarted in Yately, UK.

An ocean technology company and brand of Sea-Bird Scientific that develops optical sensors for aquatic research and water quality monitoring. The company was initially founded in 1990. Danaher acquired three ocean science instrumentation companies, Sea-Bird Electronics (2008), WET Labs (2010), and Satlantic (2011), which were then combined to form Sea-Bird Scientific.

A company that develops, manufactures and distributes industry-specific systems and solutions for contactless temperature measurement (infrared radiation thermometers) with long-term stability of temperatures ranging from -100 to 3000 degrees Celsius. The product range is complemented by display and networking devices, accessories for mounting, adapting and protecting the instruments, calibration certification as well as configuration and evaluation software. Founded in 1995.

Based in the USA, Microtrac is a pioneer and leading manufacturer of light scattering instruments for particle analysis. While Microtrac existed first as a business segment within a larger organization, the company Microtrac Inc. was ultimately founded in 1999.

A manufacturer of flow imaging particle analysis solutions. Including the flagship product, the FlowCam. Founded in 1999. Fluid Imaging Technologies, Inc. changed its name to Yokogawa Fluid Imaging Technologies, Inc. on April 29, 2020 when it was acquired by Yokogawa Electric Corporation.

A company based in Herisau, Switzerland, that manufactures high-precision instruments for chemical analysis. The Metrohm Group was founded in 1943; it includes Metrohm Applikon, specialised in online analysers, and Metrohm Autolab, focused on instruments for electrochemical research.
A UK-based company that designs, manufactures and distributes high quality meteorological sensors for professional markets, including aviation, offshore platforms and wind energy. Founded in 1975.

A Japanese company founded in 1917 and headquartered in Tokyo. Nikon specialises in the design, manufacture and sale of optical instruments and imaging products, including cameras, camera lenses, binoculars, microscopes, ophthalmic lenses, measurement instruments, and rifle and spotting scopes.
A Swedish manufacturer of network cameras, access control, and network audio devices for the physical security and video surveillance industries. Founded in 1983.

A Dutch company established in 1911 specialising in measurement, monitoring, and sampling equipment for soil and water applications. Eijkelkamp is headquartered in the village of Giesbeek in The Netherlands.

A UK-based marine science charity focused on providing evidence-based environmental solutions to societal challenges by applying cutting-edge, interdisciplinary research that benefits society and promotes stewardship of marine ecosystems. PML also has commercial trading subsidiary, PML Applications Ltd, which delivers services, products and solutions related to the marine environment in key sectors such as ballast water management and biofouling.
Nortek designs, develops and produces scientific instruments that apply the Doppler principle to underwater acoustics in order to measure water in motion, such as currents and waves.
A UK-based company with offices in the US specialising in the creation of subsea navigation, positioning and marine products. Founded in 1989.
An ocean technology company based in Nova Scotia, Canada. Ocean Sonics specialise in digital hydrophones for both discrete measurement and long term monitoring applications.

A provider of navigation solutions, including radars, compass systems, steering systems, speed logs, integrated bridge and control systems. Established in 1997 from three well-known names in the marine industry: Sperry Gyrocompass, C. Plath and Decca. Formed part of the Northrop Grumman group in 2001.
GEOSense is a developer and manufacturer of tools for professional geophysicists based in California. It was established in 1994.
A North American company that develops and manufactures meteorological instruments. It was founded in 1964 and is based in Michigan, USA.

A US-based company providing calibration, maintenance and repair of oceanographic and radiometric equipment formerly made by HOBI Labs Inc., which ceased operations in 2014. They also offer select built-to-order products.
A US based company providing healthcare systems, technologies and biomedical testing. An operating company of Danaher Corporation since 2011. Founded in 1935.

Chelsea Technologies Group (CTG) is a UK limited company specialising in a range of sensors and systems for the oceanographic, maritime, environmental, defence, homeland security, and industrial process control markets. CTG was formerly Chelsea Instruments Ltd until April 2007.
A company founded in 2001 that specialises in analysers for carbon dioxide parameters in aquatic systems.
A UK based company that manufactures force-feedback, broadband seismometers, accelerometers and data acquisition systems for a range of research and industrial applications. Founded in 1987.

A US company founded in 2006 and based in Santa Cruz, California, USA. Ocean Presence Technologies specialises in the design and manufacture of underwater camera systems with applications in ocean research, environmental monitoring and aquariums.
An American technology company founded in 2002. It manufactures action cameras and develops mobile apps and video-editing software.

A brand of Thermo Fisher Scientific. Thermo Fisher Scientific is an American biotechnology company founded in 2006 by the merger of Thermo Electron and Fisher Scientific. Following multiple mergers with other companies, the company has offices and locations world-wide with approximately 70,000 employees.

A Greek governmental research organisation operating under the supervision of the General Secretariat for Research and Technology (GSRT) of the Ministry of Education, Research and Religious Affairs. The HCMR comprises three Research Institutes: the Institute of Marine Biology, Biotechnology and Aquaculture (IMBBC), the Institute of Marine Biological Resources and Inland Waters (IMBRIW) and the Institute of Oceanography (IO).

Seametrics, a member of the TASI Flow Group, is a designer and manufacturer of a variety of flow metering and submersible sensor products for users in irrigation, fracking, water and wastewater, environmental, and processing applications. Founded in 1990.

A company specialising in development of various types of sampling equipment for oceanographic, environmental and pollution investigations. Supplying equipment to universities, research institutes, municipal authorities and consulting engineers specialising in environmental and pollution affairs. Founded in 1979.

A Japanese technology company with offices worldwide, which produces analytical and measuring instruments, medical systems, aircraft equipment and industrial machinery for use in a variety of research fields.
A Canadian manufacturer of underwater sonar equipment founded in 1988. Renowed for the development of the Delta T multibeam sonar unit.
A German company founded in 1991, headquartered in Jena, specialising in the manufacturing of customised measurement technology.

A brand of Sea-Bird Scientific, the business manufactures oceanographic and environmental fluorometers, transmissometers, scattering sensors and spectrophotometers. The company was initially founded in 1992. Danaher acquired three ocean science instrumentation companies, Sea-Bird Electronics (2008), WET Labs (2010), and Satlantic (2011), which were then combined to form Sea-Bird Scientific.

Imenco AS is a Norwegian company based in Aksdal, founded in 1979 as an engineering company. Imenco is a group of companies working mainly in five business areas: offshore oil and gas, offshore renewables, aquaculture, marine and naval, and industrial. The company specialises in mechanical, hydraulic and electrical engineering, in particular subsea and surface camera, light, laser, and electronic technologies.
A manufacturer or developer exists but the information is unavailable at this time.

A Japanese company founded as Matsushita Electric Industrial Co., Ltd. in 1935, and incorporated as Panasonic in 2008. Panasonic is headquartered in Kadoma, Osaka - Japan and designs and manufactures a wide range of products from batteries to consumer products, to automotive and avionic systems.
There is no manufacturer or developer

A Teledyne Marine brand established in 2013, that specialises in the design, development, manufacture and commissioning of advanced multibeam sonar-systems, sensors, transducers, hydrophones and survey software. They operate in the hydrographic, offshore, dredging, defense and  security and marine-research business areas. The founding company was established in 1976 by three brothers (Jens, Claus and Per resen Steenstrup) as RESON A/S. It is notable for the development of the SeaBat multibeam sonar system and acquired ATLAS HYDROGRAPHIC in 2014.

A Xylem brand, headquartered in Bergen (Norway) that designs, manufactures and sells sensors, instruments and systems for measuring and monitoring in Environmental Research, Marine Transportation, Oil and Gas, Aquaculture, Road and Traffic and Construction.

Teledyne Benthos designs and manufactures rugged and reliable oceanographic instrumentation and sensor solutions for marine environments. Teledyne Benthos product lines include: Acoustic Communications, Acoustic Recovery, and Acoustic Positioning Technology. The company was originally known as Benthos, founded in 1962 in North Falmouth, Massachus​etts, US. In 1999, Benthos acquired the products of Datasonics, Inc. a maker of geophysical survey equipment, underwater modems, and locator devices. In 2006, Benthos was acquired by Teledyne Technologies Incorporated and is now known as Teledyne Benthos.

A subsidiary of the Navico group that specialises in that specialises in navigation products for marine vessels. It was established in 1946. In 2008 the company absorbed MX Marine - acquired as a result of the takeover by Navico of the marine electronics division of Brunswick New Technologies Inc in 2007.
A Canadian based company that designes and manufactures underwater acoustic technologies for commercial, research, defence and surveillance applications.

A Finland-based company that specialises in environmental measurement, especially weather measurement. The company was established in 1936 by Professor Vilho Vaisala and initially manufactured radiosondes.

A company that specialises in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics technologies for agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation and logistics applications. It was founded in 1978.

A subsea technology company that designs and manufactures a range of high-performance sensor solutions designed for use on underwater vehicles (such as Remotely Operated and Autonomous Vehicles) and can also be used in a number of other underwater applications. Impact Subsea provides sensor solutions to the Oil and Gas, Renewables, Underwater Research and Defence markets. Established in 2015, the company has developed a portfolio of underwater technology encompassing Sonars; Altimeters; Depth Sensors; Attitude and Heading Reference Systems; Flooded Member Detection Systems and bespoke Pressure Housings.

A UK-based company that designs and manufactures instrumentation for the oceanographic, hydrometric and hydrographic markets, with a worldwide customer base that includes the environmental, military, oil and gas, renewable, construction, dredging and civil engineering sectors. It was founded near Dartmouth, in Devon in 1969 by Jim Stevens and originally sold the Braystoke Flow Meter, an impeller-type device which was used in the feasibility study for the Thames Barrier. The popularity of this led to an expansion of the company into other types of flow meters and accessories. Valeport was then purchased in 1982 by Oceonics Group PLC prior to their flotation, which led to an expansion of Valeport's expertise to include CTD measurement. Oceonics sold Valeport in 1985.

A large, global company that develops and manufacturers products for the measurement of salinity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, fluorescence, nutrients and related oceanographic parameters in marine waters. It is formed from three ocean science companies, Sea-Bird Electronics, WET Labs and Satlantic that were combined in 2011.
